title: 00840 no s4
message:
820-00840 again..
this one had power problems initially, but after replacing both CD3215s i got it to go to 20v
it draws 0 amps
ppbus is present at 13V
S5 both 3.3v and 5v are there, i get S5_PWRGD
S4 isn't (no shorts found)
missing enables for S4
missing pm_batlow_l

I'm having a bad day and could use some guidance
by the way i have RTC and CLK at 32KHz

title: 00840 no s4
message:
PM_BATLOW_L should be high.
Are you using 61/87W original charger?
Does it charge the battery?
Test if starts with both charger and battery connected.

title: 00840 no s4
message:
yeah this is an original 87W charger

with battery connected its drawing around 1.1A and 12,5V is going into the battery. still no S4 though

title: 00840 no s4
message:
Check PM_SLP_SUS_L, PM_RSNRST_L and PM_PWRBTN_L.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

title: 00840 no s4
message:
PM_SLP_SUS_L = 3.32V
PM_RSMRST_L = 3.32V
PM_PWRBTN_L = 3.32V

triggered SMC_ONOFF_L gives drop pulse on PM_PWRBTN_L (drops to around 0,4V says multimeter)

title: 00840 no s4
message:
ok. just continued testing, all above voltages are gone now, as is PP5V_S5.. 
in my understanding the enable for the PP5V_S5 comes from the PMIC through U7890, right?
If I dont have this, am i looking at a bad PMIC?

title: 00840 no s4
message:
You must check LDO outputs of PMIC.
Do you have stable 3V3_G3H and PPBUS_G3H?

title: 00840 no s4
message:
this one had a shorted PMIC. pp3v3_s5 was shorted under it.
thanks for the help!
